description.narrative: By 2020, strengthened capacity to develop and implement an evidence based child-sensitive and inclusive social protection policy framework

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, strengthened capacity to develop and implement an evidence based child-sensitive and inclusive social protection policy framework

description.narrative: During 2019 Mozambique achieved full implementation of the Child Grant 0-2 pilot, finalized migration into the new MIS, initiated re-registration process and produced a new draft operational manual of the Basic Social Subsidy Programme with UNICEF's technical and financial support through the UNJP on Social Protection. Quantitative baseline report on the Child Grant was produced and process evaluation initiated. As part of UNICEF's response to emergency, cash-based transfers and shock responsive social protection were also introduced to the workplan by supporting child-sensitive targeting, C4D complementary activities, expansion of the Child Grant into shock-affected/prone districts and learning for improving system's shock-responsiveness. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of households receiving humanitarian cash transfers through UNICEF response to COVID-19 [COVIDSitRep]
Public investments in non-contributory social protection programmes measured as a percentage of the national budget
coverage of social cash transfers for vulnerable households, and particularly households with children
Evidence: Existence of data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (such as health, education, nutrition etc...)
